channel.title: Comments on: Software For A New Windows 2000 Server

item.title: By: Joseph Scott’s Blog » Active Directory With nss_ldap And pam_ldap On FreeBSD
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott’s Blog » Active Directory With nss_ldap And pam_ldap On FreeBSD
item.description: [...] Back in January of I had mentioned using SFU with nss_ldap on FreeBSD on my old blog. Now that I’ve got a couple of fresh Windows 2000 servers with Active Directory and SFU (Windows Services For Unix) I figured now was a good time to write a howto on making FreeBSD use nss_ldap and pam_ldap in conjunction with Active Directory. I’m using Windows 2000, SFU 3.5, FreeBSD 5.2.1-RELEASE, nss_ldap 1.204_5 and pam_ldap 1.6.9 for this write up. [...]
item.content:encoded: […] Back in January of I had mentioned using SFU with nss_ldap on FreeBSD on my old blog. Now that I’ve got a couple of fresh Windows 2000 servers with Active Directory and SFU (Windows Services For Unix) I figured now was a good time to write a howto on making FreeBSD use nss_ldap and pam_ldap in conjunction with Active Directory. I’m using Windows 2000, SFU 3.5, FreeBSD 5.2.1-RELEASE, nss_ldap 1.204_5 and pam_ldap 1.6.9 for this write up. […]
